p: In vitro data have shown that the oxysterols negatively affect many cell types: the brain, eyes, heart, bone, colon, and prostate cells [ 7]. Oxysterols have been identified as important actors in the pathophysiology of several age-related diseases, such as atherosclerosis, type 2 diabetes mellitus, Alzheimerâ€™s disease, age-related macular degeneration (ARMD) and cataract, osteoporosis, and some forms of cancer (colon carcinoma and prostate cancer) [ 4, 6, 7].
